3.5.1.title: Identify & Authenticate Users and Devices
3.5.1.officialRequirement: Identify system users, processes acting on behalf of users, and devices; authenticate (or verify) their identities as a prerequisite to system access.
3.5.1.why: If we can’t prove *who* or *what* is connecting, zero-trust falls apart—CUI and GCC-High tenant get exposed.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: **Entra ID** is authoritative: every human and service principal must exist here first.
All endpoints enrol in **Intune**; compliance state is checked at token issuance (device identity).
**Managed identities** replace shared service credentials in Azure Functions and Logic Apps.
**Sentinel UEBA** alerts on unknown Object-IDs or devices missing serial #.

employeePerspective.title: What This Means for Employees
content: Log on only with your MVL account—personal Microsoft accounts are blocked.
Every company laptop is named `MVL-<serial>`; spoofing names fails the compliance check.
Forgotten password? Use **Self-Service Password Reset (SSPR)**, backed by MFA.

managementPerspective.title: Business Impact & Risk Management
content: Zero ‘unknown device’ connections since mandatory Intune (March 2024).
Provides clean audit trail that satisfies both CMMC and DFARS 252.204-7012(b).
Enables accurate license counting, saving ≈ USD 18 k/yr.

mvlTips: Weekly Sentinel query *“UnknownDeviceSignIns”* must return **0**; CAB reviews if not.
Service principals rotate secrets every 90 days via GitHub Action.
steps: Onboard all user and service IDs to Entra ID.
Force Intune compliance at CA level.
Roll PowerShell script to replace creds with managed identities.

3.5.2.title: Uniquely Identify Users
3.5.2.officialRequirement: Ensure that the system uniquely identifies and authenticates organizational users.
3.5.2.why: Shared credentials erase accountability and violate auditing rules.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Disable local ‘Administrator’; use PIM-controlled named accounts (e.g. `sajesh-priv`).
Guests provisioned with **B2B External** IDs—always `firstname.lastname.ext@mvl‐guest.com`.
All Linux sudo activity logs the exact user via sudo-iolog ➜ Sentinel.

employeePerspective.title: What This Means for Employees
content: Never share your password—even with IT. Support uses screen-share + elevation, not your creds.

quiz.q: How are privileged Windows accounts named at MVL?

3.5.3.title: Use Multifactor Authentication
3.5.3.officialRequirement: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.
3.5.3.why: Microsoft data: MFA blocks 99.9 % of credential-stuffing attacks.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: **FIDO2 security keys** required for Global Admins and Developers.
All other users: Entra push + number match; SMS banned.
CA policy ‘MFA-Everywhere’ scoped tenant-wide; excludes break-glass.
**Defender for Cloud Apps** forces MFA re-auth if session risk rises to ‘Medium+’.
Sentinel analytic *MFA-Bypass* triggers SOC P1 on legacy protocol usage.

employeePerspective.title: What This Means for Employees
content: Expect number-match prompt on phone or tap your YubiKey.
Travelling? Push notifications may be slower—plan extra 30 s.
Lost phone/key? Call Service Desk, they’ll issue temp OTP good for 8 h.
MFA rollout dropped compromised-account tickets from 12/month → 0 (since Aug 2024).
MFA evidence satisfies IRS 1075, CMMC IA, and cyber-insurer questionnaire.

mvlTips: YubiKeys stored in badge lanyards; replacement stock kept in IT Store Rm 2.
Break-glass account has long random password in physical safe #3; access logged.
steps: Ship FIDO2 keys to privileged users.
Enforce CA ‘Require Compliant + MFA’ on all cloud apps.
Create Sentinel analytic for legacy auth attempts.

quiz.q: What factor **is not** allowed at MVL for MFA?

3.5.4.title: Replay-Resistant Authentication
3.5.4.officialRequirement: Employ replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for network access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.
3.5.4.why: Tokens that can be replayed allow pass-the-hash attacks.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Disable NTLM in domain; force **Kerberos** or token-based OIDC.
TLS 1.3 for all external endpoints—PFS thwarts capture-replay.
SSH servers require **PubKey + FIDO2**; passwords disabled.

quiz.q: Which protocol is blocked to enforce replay-resistant auth on Windows servers?

3.5.5.title: Prevent Identifier Re-Use
3.5.5.officialRequirement: Prevent reuse of identifiers for a defined period.
3.5.5.why: Recycling UPNs could link new hires to old audit history, confusing investigations.

content: AAD recycle bin retains deleted UPNs for 180 days; script blocks creation during that period.
Email aliases marked ‘retired’ for one year before re-assignment.

3.5.6.title: Disable Identifiers After Inactivity
3.5.6.officialRequirement: Disable user identifiers after a defined period of inactivity.
3.5.6.why: Dormant accounts are top attack targets.

content: AAD **Access Reviews** auto-disable accounts idle 35 days (contractors).
Intune device objects stale > 30 days auto-deleted; CA blocks them.

3.5.7.title: Enforce Password Complexity / Length
3.5.7.officialRequirement: Enforce minimum password complexity and change of characters when new passwords are created.

content: **Azure AD Password Protection**: min 14 chars, banned-password list (500 k entries).
SSPR forces random pass if reset; users can go password-less but not weaker.
Local administrator passwords rotated by **LAPS** every 24 h.

quiz.q: Minimum password length in AAD Password Protection?

3.5.8.title: Prohibit Password Re-Use
3.5.8.officialRequirement: Prohibit password reuse for a specified number of generations.

content: AAD remembers last **24** passwords; cannot be reused.
Service accounts converted to managed identities—no rotation headaches.

3.5.9.title: Limit Temporary Password Use
3.5.9.officialRequirement: Allow use of temporary passwords only for system-defined time period.
3.5.9.why: Temp creds in onboarding emails are tasty phishing bait.

content: Temp passwords in AAD expire in **24 h**; enforced via Company Portal.
Service Desk uses **Passwordless QR** for in-person resets—no temp pass at all.

3.5.10.title: Protect Passwords in Storage & Transit
3.5.10.officialRequirement: Store and transmit only cryptographically protected passwords.

content: AAD stores salted + hashed pass (PBKDF2).
LDAP Simple Bind disabled; only LDAPS.
**Application Gateway** offloads TLS 1.3 with AES-256.

3.5.11.title: Obscure Authentication Feedback
3.5.11.why: Login errors should not confirm a username to brute-forcers.

content: AAD custom error: generic ‘Incorrect user or password’.
Lock-screen hides last logged-in user on Windows (`DontDisplayLastUserName`).

3.5.12.title: Authenticate Network Devices
3.5.12.officialRequirement: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of devices before establishing a network connection.
3.5.12.why: Rogue Pi on the VLAN? No thanks.

content: **802.1X** EAP-TLS with certs from MVL-CA; MAC bypass disabled.
Zscaler Client Connector enforces device posture before split-tunnel traffic.

quiz.q: What protocol verifies wired & Wi-Fi devices at MVL HQ?
